intro: Garnotia tenuiglumis, commonly known as the slender-leaved garnotia, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinctive glabrous surface. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that attract various pollinators.
